refnamediv.refpurpose: Zero-delay feedback implementation of 1 pole filter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Zero-delay feedback implementation of a 1 pole (6 dB/oct) filter. Offers low-pass (default), high-pass, and allpass output modes.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: asig zdf_1pole ain, xcf [, kmode, istor]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: istor --initial disposition of internal data space. Since filtering incorporates a feedback loop of previous output, the initial status of the storage space used is significant. A zero value will clear the space; a non-zero value will allow previous information to remain. The default value is 0.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: xcf -- filter cutoff frequency (i-, k-, or a-rate).

kmode -- filter output type. The default value is 0. The output mode may be one of the following.
0 - low-pass
1 - high-pass
2 - allpass

refsect1.title: References
refsect1.para: This filter is based on the work of Will Pirkle that employs Vadim Zavalishin's work with bilinear tranforms to create topology-preserving transform (TPT) implementations of analog filters.
